name: Jaz Mirabel Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed at mirabel beach the 4* resort is behind this hotel so be careful when booking! we had a brilliant time, asked for a quieter room near to beach and pool view which we we given, for a huge complex it was great.... clean, rooms comfortable, (it is Egypt) apart from lat day bo tummy upsets, and food fantastic, we did spend extra on buying for £50 voucher that allows you to eat 3 times at the al a carte restuarants the lebanese was fantastic, also the asian, italian not so good. remember to tip we had wonderful service from islam at pool snack bar cups of tea were very welcome. it was very hot when we were there and the pool shades are a must. the only down side was i feel a walkway to the reef should be made, we walked out and really there is live coral TRYING to grow and will never establish if we holiday makers keep walking over it..... wear beach shoes, coral sharp and watch out for seaurchins, YUK they are everywhere and spikes painful. yes we will return and try the kitesurfing, at colona sprts, out hotel turn right along the beach and 2 mins ahve a great centre. enjoy
reviews.title: brilliant holiday

likes.liked: — friendliness of staff and helpfullness... food
likes.disliked: — entertainment was dreadful but we didnt go for that!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just had a great week at Jaz Mirabel. The hotel was very clean and comfortable throughout, we got a family room for the 2 of us which was huge.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — Cleanliness, size of room, great showers

reviews.title: Very Relaxing
reviews.text: There were plenty of sunbeds - no need to put a towel down to reserve your bed!!! Sea & beach close by with plenty of beds as well.

The staff were friendly & helpful - no doubt because they hoped for a tip at the end of the week. Someone on trip ad has complained at the Egyptians "efforts" to try and make a joke - lighten up, it's their way of trying to be friendly and show you that they know some English - no doubt more than you know in Egyptian.
reviews.title: it was absolutely amazinggggg!!!!

likes.liked: — everything - i think the staff made it great though.
likes.disliked: — to be honest with you all, there is nothing i can complain about.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was ok - I say that because as a vegetarian it was a little difficult but plenty of good choice for meat eaters. The restaurants had "themed" buffet nights so you got an Oriental night, a French night, an English night etc etc - if there had been more typical Egyptian food it would have been better for me. However, breakfasts were great and there was plenty of choice at the snack bars.
reviews.title: Superb Jaz Mirabel Beach
don't forget to take your own vinegar
reviews.text: Very large complex, good weather good sunning swimming areas not very crowded.

reviews.title: loved th break
reviews.text: Beach nearby, can not take any shells out of country so don't collect them for keeps.
Take US dollars and Euros and a few Egyption dollars for good measure.
reviews.title: Good holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tip in $1.00 at a go only 50 pence.
reviews.title: wow what a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tip the waiter in the bar and resturant once per night witht he $1.00 and they wait on you very well. My beer glass was always full on my return etc.
reviews.title: 5 star hotel (?), 4 star experience

reviews.text: Excellent service, we were made to feel special by the staff.In particular Tamer, the manager of the beach restaurant where we had lunch most days and had the tastiest home made burgers and greek salad ever,
reviews.title: Egyptian Delight

reviews.text: Wael ,manager of the buffet restaurant who always ensured we had a perfectly set table and all drinks we requiredwithout our having to ask, and Sayed with his lovely smile which never faded no matter how busy he wasor how many tables he had to clear.
reviews.title: Give this one a body swerve!

likes.disliked: — Linen rooms next to lots of bedrooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Issac, in the bar who always found you a table no matter how full the bar was and Yasser who always came up trumps with his cocktails.
reviews.title: NIce Hotel , but bit boring

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel wasexceptionally clean and the furnishings were luxurious.There was always a great variety of food and of a good quality.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — A la Carte Restaurants get booked out too quickly.

reviews.text: None of our party experienced the Egyptian tummy which almost everyone I had spoken to before I went said they experienced.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hi,just back yesterday from the jaz mirabel beach.Beautiful hotel and great surrondings,food was good,plenty of choice for everyone.The hotel has a shuttle bus to naama bay for 38 egpounds return which was good.The only thing i didnt like was the hotel staff coudnt understand you,even the reception staff didnt speak enough english to get by!!i asked what time the shops closed in naama bay,they kept pointing to the shuttle bus,saying yes naama bay!!if you want good service you MUST tip because if you dont they dont bother much.at the buffet restaurants they get drinks for you,if you tip theyll remember you and come and speak to you.we didnt tip first few days and had to stop waiters going past to get drinks,once we started tipping they started welcoming us,good morning,afternoon,evening,how was ur day etc.even in the snack bars they remeber if you tipped and come runing over but if you dont ,they take their time.also too too many russians at the the hotel,quite intimidating at times,since very loud and generally rude.hardly any americans at all,was told they go to other hotels nearby,overall good hotel but i wouldnt go back because i never go to the same hotel twice and also im sure plenty of other better ones out there.thomsons are dear for their excursions,we were on a cruise and stay and did them on the ship,but you can get same excursions in naama bay half price.some traders are very pushy but you have to either ignore and walk by or if you start talking they will try to rip you off with prices and then say we give u discount ,tell me how much ur best price etcalways barter for prices since they double their prices befor giving u discount.also in the hotel newspaper man was walking around selling the sun newspaper and womans own,best magazines for £3 each!!!it was annonying that people expected you to tip all times.beach was disappointing due to sharp rocks ,coral,u had to walk out 10 mins to swim.they have a camel on the beach for rides also,
reviews.title: nice hotel

likes.liked: — the good food and nice surroundings

reviews.text: Got to Sharm airport and what a shambles, after 5 hour flight it was ages to get through customs/passport control,
reviews.title: Nice hotel shame about the food

reviews.text: After this it got better. The thompson rep was excellent.
reviews.title: Fabulous Jaz Mirabel park, sharm el sheikh

likes.liked: — the whole standard was just fabulous
likes.disliked: — the lacking of entertainment and the lack of different bars and the ealy closing times!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We bought the Visas because we were going to Cairo.
reviews.title: Fantastic Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was lucky because if you venture anywhere out of Sharm you need to have the Visa.
reviews.title: Oasis of luxury

likes.liked: — Great room and attentive, friendly staff
likes.disliked: — Red wine and perhaps the vastness of the complex!

aka: Jaz Mirabel Beach Hotel Sharm El Sheikh
